Class LineGraph2DRenderer

  • java.lang.Object

    carcassi

      • isHighlightFocusValue

        public boolean isHighlightFocusValue()
        Current state of highlightFocusValue.
        • True - highlight and show the value the mouse is on.
        • False - Avoid calculation involved with finding the highlighted value/ do not highlight the value.
        Returns:
        true or false

      • getFocusValueIndex

        public int getFocusValueIndex()
        Current index of the value that the mouse is focused on.
        Returns:
        focused index (in the dataset).

      • getFocusPixelX

        public Integer getFocusPixelX()
        Current x-position(pixel) of the value that the mouse is focused on.
        Returns:
        the x position that the mouse is focused on in the graph (pixel).

      • update

        public void update(LineGraph2DRendererUpdate update)
        Description copied from class: Graph2DRenderer
        Applies the update to the renderer.

        When sub-classing, one should re-implement this method by first calling it and then applying all the updates specific to the sub-class.

        Overrides:
        update in class Graph2DRenderer<LineGraph2DRendererUpdate>
        Parameters:
        update - the update to apply

      • processScaledValue

        protected void processScaledValue(int index,
                                  double valueX,
                                  double valueY,
                                  double scaledX,
                                  double scaledY)
        Description copied from class: Graph2DRenderer
        Empty function, designed to be implemented in sub-classes.

        Used on every value in a dataset.

        Overrides:
        processScaledValue in class Graph2DRenderer<LineGraph2DRendererUpdate>
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the value
        valueX - the x value
        valueY - the y value
        scaledX - the x pixel
        scaledY - the y pixel
